basics.name: Alexander Moshir
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am currently pursuing a B.S. in Computer Science within the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii, with an anticipated graduation in Fall 2026. In parallel, I am actively participating in the AFROTC program, preparing to commission as an Officer in the U.S. Air Force upon completion of my degree.

courses: AS 101, 102, 201, 202, 301, 302 & Labs: Air Force Reserve Officer Training Corps Training and Curriculum
ICS 141: Discrete Mathematics for Computer Science I
ICS 211: Introduction to Computer Science II
ICS 222: Basic Concepts of Computer Science
ICS 241: Discrete Mathematics for Computer Science II
PHYS 151, 152 & Labs: College Physics I-II & Labs

work.summary: Training sponsored by the Office of Naval Research offered to ROTC STEM students at UH Manoa. Utilizing Linux tools and security software to learn cyber security technical skills.

volunteer.summary: Managing and maintaining a self-built TrueNAS server for personal use and hosting services for friends and family.
highlights: Utilizing Unix to create and manage jails and VMs with tools such as vi and shell
Setting up and maintaining services including Plex, Calibre, Sonarr, and Tautulli
Deploying and managing game servers by utilizing services such as MineOS or configuring them in custom jails
Utilizing SMB for file transfers between devices on the network

volunteer.summary: Developing and maintaining BlueMaps, a webapp that provides an interactive map of the Blue Hole from the game Dave the Diver
highlights: Utilizing HTML, CSS, and Javascript to create the front-end of the static webpage
Working with GitHub Pages to host the website and manage version control
Implementing Leaflet to create an interactive Map and UI
Designing Overlays and Maps with Krita

volunteer.summary: CyberPatriot is the National Youth Cyber Education Program created by the Air & Space Forces Association to inspire K-12 students toward careers in cybersecurity or other science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) disciplines critical to our nation's future. At the core of the program is the National Youth Cyber Defense Competition, the nation's largest cyber defense competition that puts high school and middle school students in charge of securing virtual networks.
highlights: Team 2 Cisco Networking Security Lead for Civil Air Patrol Squadron 56
